I too came across the info concerning the Shindo Munen ryu. The
Yagyu Shinkage bit is interesting, though... thanks for the help!

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Tom Helm <junkmail@t...>
wrote:
> Kyle et al-
> The upper class members of the Choshu han studied Yagyu
Shinkage
> Ryu,(Takasugi Shinsaku was a Yagyu Shinkage Ryu swordman...) I
haven't
> been able to find a ryuha for the Middle and lower classes prior
to
> Kaei. At which time Saito Shintaro established a Shindo Munen Ryu
dojo
> there with the permission of the Mori. The aforementioned Katsura
> Kogoro was a Shindo Munen ryu adept who became well known in Edo
> circles thru his fencing ability...
> -t

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Choshu han ryu?
messages.msgSnippet: Hey: Question: was the style Yagyu Shinkage Ryu the one taught by Tokugawa swordsmasters the Yagyu clan, from which comes the nebulous Yagyu Jubei?  Just
messages.messageBody:
Hey:
Question: was the style Yagyu Shinkage Ryu the one taught by Tokugawa
swordsmasters the Yagyu clan, from which comes the nebulous Yagyu Jubei? Just
wondering. 8-D

L8r
Tim


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Choshu han ryu?
messages.msgSnippet: Kyle et al- The upper class members of the Choshu han studied Yagyu Shinkage Ryu,(Takasugi Shinsaku was a Yagyu Shinkage Ryu swordman...) I haven t been able
messages.messageBody:
Kyle et al-
The upper class members of the Choshu han studied Yagyu Shinkage
Ryu,(Takasugi Shinsaku was a Yagyu Shinkage Ryu swordman...) I haven't
been able to find a ryuha for the Middle and lower classes prior to
Kaei. At which time Saito Shintaro established a Shindo Munen Ryu dojo
there with the permission of the Mori. The aforementioned Katsura
Kogoro was a Shindo Munen ryu adept who became well known in Edo
circles thru his fencing ability...
-t

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Choshu han ryu?
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Kyle, May be research on the topic of kenjutsu itself will help. In my research on the Shimazu clan, I ve had to try a number of research techniques. Like
messages.messageBody:
Hey Kyle,

May be research on the topic of kenjutsu itself will
help. In my research on the Shimazu clan, I've had to
try a number of research techniques. Like Shimazu
Clan, Satsuma Province, Kagoshima, Ryukyu,
Kyushu,Satsuma Rebelion, Iriki-in Clan and so on.

Hell I've found so realy good information by
researching Korean history ie: the Korean Wars of the
1590's.

messages.subject: Choshu han ryu?
messages.msgSnippet: I know that Satsuma han s premier kenjutsu ryu was Jigen ryu, but was there a predominant ryu in Choshu han? I ve looked through Choshu in the Meiji
messages.messageBody:
I know that Satsuma han's premier kenjutsu ryu was Jigen ryu, but
was there a predominant ryu in Choshu han? I've looked
through "Choshu in the Meiji Restoration", but didn't see anything
(not that I think it's really concerned with those kind of details
anyways).
